intro: Phymatopsis palmata, commonly known as the desert globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial shrub characterized by its fleshy, succulent stems and waxy, heart-shaped leaves that help reduce water loss in dry environments. The plant produces showy, yellow flowers in clusters, which bloom in late spring to early summer. Its root system is extensive and deep, allowing it to access groundwater in nutrient-poor soils. Phymatopsis palmata plays an important ecological role by providing habitat and food for various desert animals.
